course_title: Industry Research Project in Occupational Health & Safety Science

learning_outcomes.description: Read and critically analyse current scientific literature pertinent to the area of the research project
Identify research questions and investigate and plan appropriate methodology to address these questions.
Implement the methodology, including data collection, under the guidance of an experienced supervisor.
Record the planning and outcome of data collection accurately and appropriately.
Write a research report in a format appropriate for an industry investigation.
Critically discuss the collected data in the context of the literature, draw conclusions from such discussions and suggest further research options.

assessments.task_description:
Submit a 500 - 800 word summary providing an overview of the proposed project, including the overall aim of the project. Provide details of how the project is relevant to the workplace and discuss the feasibility of its completion within 240 hour period. The document must be endorsed by the workplace supervisor. The template for the project plan can be accessed in Blackboard.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to submit a 2000 - 3000 word research proposal covering the following elements:

  • Title
  • General Aim
  • Specific objectives/research questions
  • Rationale - background and justification of the project
  • Literature Review
  • Methodology
  • Resources needed
  • References
  • Risk Assessment
  • Ethical considerations


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to present a 15 minute oral presentation on their research project to academic and industry stakeholders. The presentation will be followed by a 15 minute question and answer period.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to present a project report in the vicinity of 6000 - 8000 words. The report should contain the following elements:

  • Abstract
  • Introduction
  • Literature Review
  • Method (Research design, subjects, data collection tools, procedure)
  • Results
  • Discussion
  • Conclusions
  • Implications for further research
  • References


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 2(23 Feb - 08 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Plan

During Week 2 students are required to finalise their project topic and complete a project plan.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Plan During Week 2 students are required to finalise their project topic and complete a project plan.

learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Orientation

During Week 1 students will be required to orientate themselves to the workplace and identify an appropriate industry research topic.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Orientation During Week 1 students will be required to orientate themselves to the workplace and identify an appropriate industry research topic.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 5(09 Mar - 29 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Proposal

During Weeks 3 - 5 students are required to complete a formal project proposal, including: literature review, research questions and methodology. Students should also develop or modify data collection tools as required.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Proposal During Weeks 3 - 5 students are required to complete a formal project proposal, including: literature review, research questions and methodology. Students should also develop or modify data collection tools as required.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 6 To Week 9(30 Mar - 03 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Data Collection

During Weeks 6 - 9 students will undertake the data collection phase of their industry research project.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Data Collection During Weeks 6 - 9 students will undertake the data collection phase of their industry research project.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 10 To Week 12(04 May - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Data Analysis

During Weeks 10 - 12 students will complete data analysis.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Data Analysis During Weeks 10 - 12 students will complete data analysis.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 13 To Exam week 1(25 May - 14 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Industry Project - Report Write-up

During Weeks 13 - 15 students will write a research report in a format appropriate for an industry investigation, including a critical analysis of collected data and the drawing of conclusions appropriate for the workplace.
learning_activities.topic_description: Industry Project - Report Write-up During Weeks 13 - 15 students will write a research report in a format appropriate for an industry investigation, including a critical analysis of collected data and the drawing of conclusions appropriate for the workplace.
